sen.j: シュンギク（春菊、学名：Chrysanthemum coronarium. Syn, Leucanthemum coronariumまたはGlebionis coronaria, 英名 Crown daisy）はキク科キク属（またはシュンギク属）に分類される原産地が地中海沿岸の植物である。
sen.e: Shungiku (春菊, the scientific name: Chrysanthemum coronarium. Syn, Leucanthemum coronarium, or Glebionis coronaria, the English name: Crown daisy) is a plant native to the Mediterranean coast, and is classified in the genus Chrysanthemum of the family Asteraceae.

Shungiku (the scientific name: Chrysanthemum coronarium, Syn, Leucanthemum coronarium, or Glebionis coronaria, the English name: Crown daisy) is a plant native to the Mediterranean coast, and is classified in the genus Chrysanthemum of the family Asteraceae.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記は不要と考え削除しました。ピリオドをコンマに訂正しました。
sen.e: Shungiku (the scientific name: Chrysanthemum coronarium, Syn, Leucanthemum coronarium, or Glebionis coronaria, the English name: Crown daisy) is a plant native to the Mediterranean coast, and is classified in the genus Chrysanthemum of the family Asteraceae.

sen.j: ヨーロッパではもっぱら観賞用。
sen.e: In Europe it is grown mostly for ornamental purposes.
In Europe it is grown mostly for ornamental purposes.
In Europe it is grown mostly for ornamental purposes.

sen.j: 春に花を咲かせ、葉の形がキク（菊）の葉の形に似ていることから、春菊と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Because the plant produces flowers in the spring and the shape of the leaves resemble that of the chrysanthemum, it is called Shungiku (spring chrysanthemum) in Japanese.
Because the plant produces flowers in the spring and the shape of the leaves resemble that of the chrysanthemum, it is called Shungiku (spring chrysanthemum) in Japanese.
Because the plant produces flowers in the spring and the shape of the leaves resemble that of the chrysanthemum, it is called Shungiku (spring chrysanthemum) in Japanese.

sen.j: 葉に切れ込みの少ない大葉（おおば）が四国、九州で（また「おたふく」、「ろーま」ともよばれる）、切れ込みのある中葉（ちゅうば）がそれ以東でそれぞれ栽培される。
sen.e: The type with less distinctly laciniated leaves is called Oba (big leaves) and is grown in Shikoku and Kyushu (where it is also referred to as "Otafuku" and "Roma"), whereas the type with laciniated leaves is called Chuba (medium-size leaves) and is grown in regions to the east of Shikoku and Kyushu.

The type with less distinctly laciniated leaves is called Oba (big leaves) and is grown in Shikoku and Kyushu (where it is also referred to as 'Otafuku' and 'Roma'), whereas the type with laciniated leaves is called Chuba (medium-size leaves) and is grown in regions to the east of Shikoku and Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: The type with less distinctly laciniated leaves is called Oba (big leaves) and is grown in Shikoku and Kyushu (where it is also referred to as 'Otafuku' and 'Roma'), whereas the type with laciniated leaves is called Chuba (medium-size leaves) and is grown in regions to the east of Shikoku and Kyushu.

sen.j: 中葉はさらに、株立ち型と株張り型とにわかれる。
sen.e: The Chuba type is further divided into the clump style (which the branched leaves are harvested) and the one-root style (which the entire plant is harvested from the root).
The Chuba type is further divided into the clump style (which the branched leaves are harvested) and the one-root style (which the entire plant is harvested from the root).
The Chuba type is further divided into the clump style (which the branched leaves are harvested) and the one-root style (which the entire plant is harvested from the root).

sen.j: 香りと葉や花の形から、関西では菊菜（きくな）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Kikuna (chrysanthemum leaves) in Kansai region, because of its scent and shapes of the leaves and flowers.
It is also called Kikuna (chrysanthemum leaves) in Kansai region, because of its scent and shapes of the leaves and flowers.
It is also called Kikuna (chrysanthemum leaves) in Kansai region, because of its scent and shapes of the leaves and flowers.

sen.j: 特有の香りを持つ葉と茎を食用とする。
sen.e: The leaves and stems with particular aroma are eaten.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The leaves and stems with particular aroma are eaten.
The leaves and stems with particular aroma are eaten.

sen.j: ビタミン、カルシウム、葉緑素が豊富に含まれている。
sen.e: The plant is rich in vitamins, calcium, and chlorophyll.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The plant is rich in vitamins, calcium, and chlorophyll.
The plant is rich in vitamins, calcium, and chlorophyll.

sen.j: すき焼き・ふぐ料理など鍋料理の具材に使われるほか、生でサラダに使われる。
sen.e: Shungiku is added to hot pots such as Sukiyaki and fugu (blow-fish) hot pot, and is also eaten fresh as salad.
Shungiku is added to hot pots such as Sukiyaki and fugu (blow-fish) hot pot, and is also eaten fresh as salad.
Shungiku is added to hot pots such as Sukiyaki and fugu (blow-fish) hot pot, and is also eaten fresh as salad.

sen.j: 天ぷらのネタとしても好まれ、「春菊天」は立ち食いそば・うどん店では定番メニューのひとつである。
sen.e: It is also popular as a tempura-dish; "shungiku-ten" (tempura of shungiku) is one of the standard items at the tachigui (standing eating style) soba and udon shops.
It is also popular as a tempura-dish; 'shungiku-ten' (tempura of shungiku) is one of the standard items at the tachigui (standing eating style) soba and udon shops.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: It is also popular as a tempura-dish; 'shungiku-ten' (tempura of shungiku) is one of the standard items at the tachigui (standing eating style) soba and udon shops.

sen.j: 旬は11月から 3月。
sen.e: Shungiku is in season between November and March.
Shungiku is in season between November and March.
Shungiku is in season between November and March.

sen.j: 味は産地によって違い、例えば東京産の春菊は苦いが、逆に広島産春菊は甘い。
sen.e: The taste varies depending on the area of its production; shungiku from Tokyo tastes bitter, whereas shungiku from Hiroshima tastes sweet.
The taste varies depending on the area of its production; shungiku from Tokyo tastes bitter, whereas shungiku from Hiroshima tastes sweet.
The taste varies depending on the area of its production; shungiku from Tokyo tastes bitter, whereas shungiku from Hiroshima tastes sweet.

sen.j: 大阪府など、都市付近で栽培されることも多い。
sen.e: In many cases, it is cultivated close to the cities such as Osaka prefecture.
In many cases, it is cultivated close to the cities such as Osaka prefecture.
In many cases, it is cultivated close to the cities such as Osaka prefecture.

sen.j: なお、食用とされるのは東アジアにおいてのみである。
sen.e: In addition, Shungiku is consumed as an edible plant only in the East Asia.
In addition, Shungiku is consumed as an edible plant only in the East Asia.
In addition, Shungiku is consumed as an edible plant only in the East Asia.

sen.j: 観賞
sen.e: Ornamental uses
Ornamental uses

sen.j: ヨーロッパでは観賞用とされている。
sen.e: In Europe it is grown for ornamental purposes.
In Europe it is grown for ornamental purposes.
In Europe it is grown for ornamental purposes.

sen.j: 日本では食用のイメージが強いせいか花のことはあまり知られていないが、写真のようにきれいな黄色い花がつく。
sen.e: The plant produces beautiful yellow flowers as seen in the photograph, which is not commonly known in Japan perhaps for the fact that the people mostly considers it as food.
The plant produces beautiful yellow flowers as seen in the photograph, which is not commonly known in Japan perhaps for the fact that the people mostly considers it as food.

sen.j: また、舌状花の外側が白い覆輪になっているものもある。
sen.e: There is also a type of shungiku which bears ligulate flowers with white outer rims.
There is also a type of shungiku which bears ligulate flowers with white outer rims.
There is also a type of shungiku which bears ligulate flowers with white outer rims.

sen.j: なお、シュンギクに似た欧米の観賞用種に、はなわぎく(Glebionis carinata)がある。
sen.e: Further, there is Hanawa giku (Glebionis carinata) which resembles shingiku, and is a variety cultivated for ornamental purpose in Europe and the United States. However, this plant is poisonous and cannot be consumed.
Further, there is Hanawa giku (Glebionis carinata) which resembles shingiku, and is a variety cultivated for ornamental purpose in Europe and the United States.

sen.j: しかし、これは有毒であり食用にはならない。
sen.e: However, this plant is poisonous and cannot be consumed.
